intro: Belosynapsis moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan belosynapsis, is a flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palm-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in tropical rainforests and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
